raw_response: {"answer_index": 2, "answer_text": "90", "confidence": 9, "reasoning": "Mean arterial pressure (MAP) can be estimated as MAP = CO × SVR. Given CO = 5 L/min and SVR = 22 mmHg/L/min, MAP = 5 × 22 = 110 mmHg. MAP is also approximately diastolic pressure + 1/3 pulse pressure. With a systolic pressure of 150 mmHg, let diastolic be X. MAP = X + 1/3(150-X) = 110. Solving: X + 50 - X/3 = 110 ⇒ (2/3)X = 60 ⇒ X = 90 mmHg. Thus, the correct answer is 90."}
